name: (2E)-2-(hydroxyimino)-3-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)propanoic acid
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-915
Reason: 2-hydroxyimino-3-hydroxy-4-methoxyphenyl propanoic acid has a melting point that we will estimate by considering the functional groups present. The basic unit for comparison can be the melting point of benzene, which is 5.5°C. The hydroxyl group (–OH) can increase the melting point by approximately +50°C due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential. The methoxy group (–OCH3) can also contribute to the melting point, estimated at around +20°C due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential. The hydroxyimino group (–NHOH) can also raise the melting point by approximately +20°C due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential. The propanoic acid group can also contribute to the melting point, estimated at around +20°C due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential.
